page.title: 02LANDSCAPE,BUILDINGS,SCENERY
page.content: This area is very{flat},lying at sea level or below,and is {drained}by a system of ditches known locally as rhynes(reens).At one time the area was under water.The village of Westonzoyland is composed mainly of modern housing with some older larger properties and farmhouses.The village is dominated by the large church with it's handsome fifteenth century tower.Looking across the land one can see good grazing land mixed with crops and copses of trees dotted around the fields.Many of the trees are dead Elms having succumbed to Dutch Elm disease and these are being gradually cleared.In the distance are the Quantock Hills (350metres high) and Poldens (100metres) 1 mile away to the North. Our rectangle is an example of The Somerset levels.
